definitions: To complete a form or document by adding information.
To provide someone with information they are missing or unaware of.
To act as a substitute for someone.
To complete or make full (a space or gap).
examples: Please fill in your name and address on the application form.
Can you fill me in on what happened at the meeting?
She had to fill in for her colleague who was sick.
He used sand to fill in the hole in the garden.
